comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.3) Gecko/20070309 Firefox/2.0.0.3
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.3) Gecko/20070309 Firefox/2.0.0.3

I have this code: "<object type="application/x-mplayer2" classid="6BF52A52-394A-11d3-B153-00C04F79FAA6" allowScriptAccess="never" allowNetworking="internal" height="100" width="425">
  <param name="allowScriptAccess" value="never" />
  <param name="allowNetworking" value="internal" />
  <param name="InvokeURLs" value="0" />
  <param name="fileName" value="http://www.fileden.com/files/2006/12/25/554468/She%20Swallowed%20It.mp3" />
  <param name="URL" value="http://www.fileden.com/files/2006/12/25/554468/She%20Swallowed%20It.mp3" />
  <param name="src" value="http://www.fileden.com/files/2006/12/25/554468/She%20Swallowed%20It.mp3" />
  <param name="autostart" value="true" />
  <param name="hidden" value="false" />
</object><noembed><bgsound src="http://www.fileden.com/files/2006/12/25/554468/She%20Swallowed%20It.mp3" loop="1"></noembed>" minus the "" on myspace page. However when I go to the url all i hear is a beep and nothing else. My music does not play in the background or does it show the player. It doesn't even tell me if I need additional plugins, all though I should because I have Quicktime Alternative, Windows Media Player, and Real, just too name the popular one. When I open my IE browser(and I dislike very much to use IE) everything is fine. So I could use a little help. PLEASE. Thank you. Corey

Reproducible: Always

1.

3.

comments.text:
This might be Tech Evangelism, but since this is the page author reporting it, that might not be productive.

After letting the page for a while (and another audio bit is playing) the status bar says Transferring data from www.fileden.com..., which is the url of the mp3 you're wishing to embed. I would personally recommend taking everything off your page and seeing if the embed works then. If it does, it's conflicting with something else on your page and this really is a Tech Evangelism issue. If not, then it's something I'm not seeing and might be a problem with your code.

comments.raw_text: I have this same problem, the embedded music on myspace shows up on other peoples computers, but not on my computer. I can't get any of the embedded music on other peoples pages either. I tried the suggestion in comment#1, but since I get the problem on anybody's page, it didn't make any difference.
comments.author: jerry_redwoods@yahoo.com
comments.text: I have this same problem, the embedded music on myspace shows up on other peoples computers, but not on my computer. I can't get any of the embedded music on other peoples pages either. I tried the suggestion in comment#1, but since I get the problem on anybody's page, it didn't make any difference.

I too have this problem, but it only started within the past few days.  Suddenly no embedded music will play within Firefox, from ANY website.  Not just Myspace.  Hell, I even upload an mp3 to a file-holder website and it doesn't work either.  I've tried switching profiles to see if it was a setting issue, but to no avail.  I've also uninstalled and reinstalled, but that has not worked either.

Somehow I get the feeling it is not conflicting apps.
comments.creator: palindrath@gmail.com
